result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. PRUCHA was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Submit DNA sample.

No possession of any firearms during probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J. PRUCHA

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change and Discharge from DOC indicating that defendant was terminated from probation effective 01-06-2017

records.addlTxt:
Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 11-13-15 at 11:30 a.m.   Plea date is set for 01-06-16 at 2:00 p.m.   Bail is set at $250.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with Brian Laurent.  Exceptions for paying rent and doing maintenance.   Bail furnished.   
Minutes.

Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
Cover Letter.

RE:  Brian Laurent, on 09-18-15.
Initial appearance is set for 10-19-15 at 1:30 p.m.
